CVE-2010-0187.title: Adobe Flash Player: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201101-09
CVE-2010-0187.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Adobe Flash Player might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service.
CVE-2010-0187.background: The Adobe Flash Player is a renderer for the SWF file format, which is commonly used to provide interactive websites.
CVE-2010-0187.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in Adobe Flash Player. For further information please consult the CVE entries and the Adobe Security Bulletins referenced below.
CVE-2010-0187.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted SWF file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2010-0295.background: lighttpd is a lightweight high-performance web server.

CVE-2010-0295.extra: A remote attacker might send specially crafted packets to a server running lighttpd, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition via host memory exhaustion.

CVE-2010-0296.title: GNU C library: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201011-01
CVE-2010-0296.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in glibc, the worst of which allowing local attackers to execute arbitrary code as root.
CVE-2010-0296.background: The GNU C library is the standard C library used by Gentoo Linux systems.
CVE-2010-0296.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in glibc, amongst others the widely-known recent LD_AUDIT and $ORIGIN issues. For further information please consult the CVE entries referenced below.
CVE-2010-0296.extra: A local attacker could execute arbitrary code as root, cause a Denial of Service, or gain privileges. Additionally, a user-assisted remote attacker could cause the execution of arbitrary code, and a context-dependent attacker could cause a Denial of Service.

CVE-2010-0302.title: CUPS: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201207-10
CVE-2010-0302.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in CUPS, some of which may allow execution of arbitrary code or local privilege escalation.
CVE-2010-0302.background: CUPS, the Common Unix Printing System, is a full-featured print server.
CVE-2010-0302.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in CUPS. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2010-0302.extra: A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code using specially crafted streams, IPP requests or files, or cause a Denial of Service (daemon crash or hang). A local attacker may be able to gain escalated privileges or overwrite arbitrary files. Furthermore, a remote attacker may be able to obtain sensitive information from the CUPS process or hijack a CUPS administrator authentication request.

CVE-2010-0547.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in mount-cifs, the worst of which leading to privilege escalation.

CVE-2010-0624.title: GNU Tar: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 201111-11
CVE-2010-0624.subTitle: A buffer overflow flaw in GNU Tar could result in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2010-0624.background: GNU Tar is a utility to create archives as well as add and extract files from archives.
CVE-2010-0624.body: GNU Tar is vulnerable to a boundary error in the rmt_read__ function in lib/rtapelib.c, which could cause a heap-based buffer overflow.
CVE-2010-0624.extra: A remote attacker could entice the user to load a specially crafted archive, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2010-0734.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated process to open a specially crafted file or URL using cURL, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code, a Denial of Service condition, disclosure of sensitive information, or unwanted actions performed via the IMAP, POP3 or SMTP protocols. CVE-2010-1512.body: A directory traversal vulnerability was discovered in aria2.

CVE-2010-1516.title: SWFTools: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 201204-05
CVE-2010-1516.subTitle: A heap-based buffer overflow in SWFTools could result in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2010-1516.background: SWFTools is a collection of SWF manipulation and generation utilities written by Rainer Böhme and Matthias Kramm.
CVE-2010-1516.body: Integer overflow errors in the "getPNG()" function in png.c and the "jpeg_load()" function in jpeg.c could cause a heap-based buffer overflow.
CVE-2010-1516.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted PNG or JPEG file, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2010-1646.title: sudo: Privilege Escalation — GLSA 201009-03

CVE-2010-1646.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in sudo:
CVE-2010-1646.extra: A local attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to gain the ability to run certain commands with the privileges of other users, including root, depending on the configuration.

CVE-2010-1675.title: Quagga: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201202-02
CVE-2010-1675.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in Quagga, the worst of which leading to remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2010-1675.background: Quagga is a free routing daemon replacing Zebra supporting RIP, OSPF and BGP.
CVE-2010-1675.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Quagga. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2010-1675.extra: A BGP peer could send a Route-Refresh message with specially-crafted ORF record, which can cause Quagga's bgpd to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Quagga's bgpd; a BGP update AS path request with unknown AS type, or malformed AS-Pathlimit or Extended-Community attributes could lead to Denial of Service (daemon crash), an error in bgpd when handling AS_PATH attributes within UPDATE messages can be exploited to cause a heap-based buffer overflow resulting in a crash of the daemon and disruption of IPv4 routing, two errors in ospf6d and ospfd can each be exploited to crash the daemon and disrupt IP routing.

CVE-2010-1676.title: Tor: Remote heap-based buffer overflow — GLSA 201101-02

CVE-2010-1676.background: Tor is an implementation of second generation Onion Routing, a connection-oriented anonymizing communication service.
CVE-2010-1676.body: Tor contains a heap-based buffer overflow in the processing of user or attacker supplied data. No additional information is available.
CVE-2010-1676.extra: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability may allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the Tor user, or to cause a Denial of Service.

CVE-2010-2233.title: libTIFF: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201209-02
CVE-2010-2233.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in libTIFF could result in execution of arbitrary code or Denial of Service.
CVE-2010-2233.background: libTIFF provides support for reading and manipulating TIFF (Tagged Image File Format) images.
CVE-2010-2233.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in libTIFF. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2010-2233.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted TIFF file with an application making use of libTIFF, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2010-2322.title: fastjar: Directory traversal — GLSA 201209-21
CVE-2010-2322.subTitle: Two directory traversal vulnerabilities have been found in fastjar, allowing remote attackers to create or overwrite arbitrary files.
CVE-2010-2322.background: fastjar is a Java archiver written in C.
CVE-2010-2322.body: Two directory traversal vulnerabilities have been discovered in fastjar. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2010-2322.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted JAR file, possibly resulting in the creation or truncation of arbitrary files.

CVE-2010-2432.title: CUPS: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201207-10
CVE-2010-2432.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in CUPS, some of which may allow execution of arbitrary code or local privilege escalation.
CVE-2010-2432.background: CUPS, the Common Unix Printing System, is a full-featured print server.
CVE-2010-2432.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in CUPS. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2010-2432.extra: A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code using specially crafted streams, IPP requests or files, or cause a Denial of Service (daemon crash or hang). A local attacker may be able to gain escalated privileges or overwrite arbitrary files. Furthermore, a remote attacker may be able to obtain sensitive information from the CUPS process or hijack a CUPS administrator authentication request.

CVE-2010-2546.title: libmikmod: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 201203-10
CVE-2010-2546.subTitle: Multiple buffer overflow vulnerabilities in libmikmod may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service condition.
CVE-2010-2546.background: libmikmod is a library to play a wide range of module formats.
CVE-2010-2546.body: Multiple boundary errors have been found in load_it.c in libmikmod, which may cause a buffer overflow.
CVE-2010-2546.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open specially crafted files in an application linked against libmikmod, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running the application, or Denial of Service.

CVE-2010-2783.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in the IcedTea JDK, the worst of which could lead to arbitrary code execution.
CVE-2010-2783.background: IcedTea is a distribution of the Java OpenJDK source code built with free build tools.
CVE-2010-2783.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the IcedTea JDK. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2010-2783.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, cause a Denial of Service condition, obtain sensitive information, bypass intended security policies, or have other unspecified impact.

CVE-2010-2883.background: Adobe Reader (formerly Adobe Acrobat Reader) is a closed-source PDF reader.

CVE-2010-2941.title: CUPS: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201207-10
CVE-2010-2941.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in CUPS, some of which may allow execution of arbitrary code or local privilege escalation.
CVE-2010-2941.background: CUPS, the Common Unix Printing System, is a full-featured print server.
CVE-2010-2941.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in CUPS. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2010-2941.extra: A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code using specially crafted streams, IPP requests or files, or cause a Denial of Service (daemon crash or hang). A local attacker may be able to gain escalated privileges or overwrite arbitrary files. Furthermore, a remote attacker may be able to obtain sensitive information from the CUPS process or hijack a CUPS administrator authentication request.

CVE-2010-2948.title: Quagga: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201202-02
CVE-2010-2948.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in Quagga, the worst of which leading to remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2010-2948.background: Quagga is a free routing daemon replacing Zebra supporting RIP, OSPF and BGP.
CVE-2010-2948.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Quagga. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2010-2948.extra: A BGP peer could send a Route-Refresh message with specially-crafted ORF record, which can cause Quagga's bgpd to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Quagga's bgpd; a BGP update AS path request with unknown AS type, or malformed AS-Pathlimit or Extended-Community attributes could lead to Denial of Service (daemon crash), an error in bgpd when handling AS_PATH attributes within UPDATE messages can be exploited to cause a heap-based buffer overflow resulting in a crash of the daemon and disruption of IPv4 routing, two errors in ospf6d and ospfd can each be exploited to crash the daemon and disrupt IP routing.

CVE-2010-2971.title: libmikmod: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 201203-10
CVE-2010-2971.subTitle: Multiple buffer overflow vulnerabilities in libmikmod may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service condition.
CVE-2010-2971.background: libmikmod is a library to play a wide range of module formats.
CVE-2010-2971.body: Multiple boundary errors have been found in load_it.c in libmikmod, which may cause a buffer overflow.
CVE-2010-2971.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open specially crafted files in an application linked against libmikmod, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running the application, or Denial of Service.

CVE-2010-3087.title: libTIFF: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201209-02

CVE-2010-3087.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in libTIFF. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2010-3087.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted TIFF file with an application making use of libTIFF, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2010-3303.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to conduct directory traversal attacks, disclose the contents of local files, inject arbitrary web scripts, obtain sensitive information, bypass authentication and intended access restrictions, or manipulate bugs and attachments.

CVE-2010-3443.body: Two vulnerabilities have been found in Quassel:
CVE-2010-3443.extra: A remote attacker could send multiple CTCP requests in single private message, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition. Futhermore, a remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary SQL statements.

CVE-2010-4203.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted media file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2010-4267.extra: A remote attacker might send specially crafted SNMP reponses, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition. Furthermore, a local attacker could perform symlink attacks to overwrite arbitrary files.

CVE-2010-4694.title: gif2png: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 201101-01
CVE-2010-4694.subTitle: gif2png contains a stack overflow vulnerability when parsing command line arguments.
CVE-2010-4694.background: gif2png is a command line program that converts image files from the Graphics Interchange Format (GIF) format to the Portable Network Graphics (PNG) format.
CVE-2010-4694.body: gif2png contains a command line parsing vulnerability that may result in a stack overflow due to an unexpectedly long input filename.
CVE-2010-4694.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted image, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or a Denial of Service. Note that applications relying on gif2png to process images can also trigger the vulnerability.

CVE-2010-4694.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted GIF file, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code, a Denial of Service condition, or the creation of PNG files in unintended directories.

CVE-2010-4707.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Linux-PAM, allowing local attackers to possibly gain escalated privileges, cause a Denial of Service, corrupt data, or obtain sensitive information.
CVE-2010-4707.background: Linux-PAM (Pluggable Authentication Modules) is an architecture allowing the separation of the development of privilege granting software from the development of secure and appropriate authentication schemes.
CVE-2010-4707.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Linux-PAM. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2010-4707.extra: A local attacker could use specially crafted files to cause a buffer overflow, possibly resulting in privilege escalation or Denial of Service. Furthermore, a local attacker could execute specially crafted programs or symlink attacks, possibly resulting in data loss or disclosure of sensitive information.

CVE-2010-5111.title: Echoping: Buffer Overflow Vulnerabilities — GLSA 201406-07
CVE-2010-5111.subTitle: A buffer overflow in Echoping might allow remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service condition.
CVE-2010-5111.background: Echoping is a small program to test performances of a remote host by sending it TCP packets.
CVE-2010-5111.body: A boundary error exists within the “TLS_readline()” function, which can be exploited to overflow a global buffer by sending an overly long encrypted HTTP reply to Echoping. Also, a similar boundary error exists within the “SSL_readline()” function, which can be exploited in the same manner.
CVE-2010-5111.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted HTTP reply, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition.
